In our application, we create a temporary project in which to store
temporary objects while Eclipse is active.  Just before Eclipse shuts down
we delete all the data in the temporary project and then delete the
project itself.  All appears well and the .project file is deleted.

One of several code snippets we have tried is below:

public void shutdown() throws CoreException {
            
            // Delete the temporary project

            IWorkspaceRoot root = SclmPlugin.getWorkspace().getRoot();

            final IProject project = root.getProject(Constants.TEMP_PROJECT);
           
            project.delete(true, true, null);
            super.shutdown();
    
    }

However, when we restart Eclipse, we get the following exception:

org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: The project description 
file (.project) for sclmawb is missing.  This file contains important 
information about the project.  The project will not function properly until 
this file is restored.

I suspect it is a result of something we did, or didn't do.  Any suggestions
would be appreciated.

This bug must have gone unnoticed.  You shouldn't be deleting the .project file
before deleting the project. Simply deleting the project from within Eclipse
will also delete all of the project's contents.
